Recipe.title: InstaPot Roast
Recipe.yields: Depends upon Beef Roast Size and amount of vegetables.
Recipe.Description: We love having Roasts for dinner on Sundays. Of course, several burners and the oven really heat up the kitchen. Until we got an InstaPot and (after a bunch of attempts) came up with this.

section.instruction: In a large container, mix Beef Broth, Worcestershire Sauce, and Tomato Sauce.
Put InstaPot in Sauté mode, put in the butter and, using a spatula, move it around so that all of the bottom surface is covered. Continue until it is melted.
Place the roast in the InstaPot, and using tongs to turn it, let it sit on every side and edge in the butter until browns spots begin to be seen on that side.
Add Garlic and stir it with a spatula for 1 minute, then turn off the InstaPot.
Use a spatula to scrap up anything sticking to the bottom of the InstaPot.
Arrange Onion slices on the bottom of the InstaPot and place the Roast on top.
Pour the Broth mixture over the Roast and set to Pressure Cook. If Roast is fresh, set for 30 minutes If Roast is frozen, set for 1 hour.

section.title: While Roast Is cooking
section.instruction: Combine Corn Starch and Cool Water in a small cup and mix thoroughly.

Peel Carrots and Potatoes then cut them into chunks the size that you would like.
(We like the Carrots spoon sized, and the Potatoes about 1"-2" cubes.)

section.title: When Pressure Cooking Completes
section.instruction: Let sit for 20 minutes, then release any pressure.
Remove Roast and cover with foil, then remove Onions and set in a bowl and cover.
Drain any broth that collected in the bowl of Onions into the InstaPot.
Put Carrots and Potatoes in Broth in InstaPot and set to Pressure Cook for 3 minutes.
When Pressure Cooking completes, release pressure immediately, and put Carrots and Potatoes in separate serving bowls.
Mix the Corn Starch mixture again very well, then slowly stir it into the Broth to create Gravy.
Remove foil and slice the Roast.

Modifications.modification: You can create the 1½-Strength Beef Broth by using 4 Cups of Water + 6 Bouillon Cubes (or the equivalent).
